Package thing.dna

Class C_Chromosome

  • java.lang.Object
    • thing.dna.C_Chromosome
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<C_Chromosome>, I_DnaThing, I_MappedDna
    public class C_Chromosome
extends java.lang.Object
implements I_MappedDna, java.lang.Comparable<C_Chromosome>
    A single "strand" of genes, capable of being mutated and crossed over with another single strand (another chromosome)
    NOTE: map locations are currently not checked for sequential ordering, so each new Gene that is added must be at a higher map location than all of the previously added Genes.
    Author:
    kyle wagner, elyk@acm.org Version 1.1, aug 28, 2002, jan 2012 J. Le Fur

    • Constructor Detail

      • C_Chromosome

        public C_Chromosome​(int numGenes,
                    I_Recombinator recombinator)
        Make a chromosome of a specific size (it's more efficient if this size is known since an ArrayList is holding the Genes).
        Parameters:
        numGenes - how many genes will be in the final chromosome (only for efficiency - if count is incorrect, chromosome will still function properly, it will simply take a longer time to construct).
        recombinator - provides a crossover method Author Kyle Wagner 2002

      • C_Chromosome

        public C_Chromosome​(double mapLength,
                    int numGenes,
                    I_Recombinator recombinator)
        Make a chromosome of a specific size (it's more efficient if this size is known since an ArrayList is holding the Genes).
        Parameters:
        mapLength - the length of this chromosome in map units
        numGenes - how many genes will be in the final chromosome (only for efficiency - if count is incorrect, chromosome will still function properly, it will simply take a longer time to construct).
        recombinator - provides a crossover method

    • Method Detail

      • mutate

        public void mutate​(java.lang.Object info)
        Potentially modify all of the Genes (or components) of this Genetic object. Variation may be constrained by a rate (a mutation rate), or other information provided in the argument, info.
        Specified by:
        mutate in interface I_DnaThing
        Parameters:
        info - An optional argument (can be null). Often this will be a Double representing a mutation rate.

      • copySegment

        public I_DnaThing copySegment​(int startLocus,
                              int endLocus)
        Creates a new chromosome which is copied from startLocus (inclusive) to endLocus (exclusive) in chromosome.
        Specified by:
        copySegment in interface I_DnaThing
        Parameters:
        startLocus - the locus where the duplication of chromosome will begin
        endLocus - the locus where duplication ends (exclusive)

      • replicate

        public C_Chromosome replicate​(java.lang.Object info)
        The replicated individual does not have to be asexual, but is most likely to have this property.
        Specified by:
        replicate in interface I_DnaThing
        Parameters:
        info - Possibly a mutation rate, or other information needed in order to perform the replication.
        Returns:
        a new Genetic object, a duplicate of this one. Mutations might have occured, however.

      • mate

        public I_DnaThing mate​(java.lang.Object info,
                       I_DnaThing parent2)
        The replicated individual does not have to be bisexual, but is most likely to have this property. N.B. JLF: could be used for procaryotes ?
        Parameters:
        info - Possibly a mutation rate, or other information needed in order to perform the mating.
        parent2 - the other individual involved in this mating.
        Returns:
        a new Genetic object, a combination of the two parents.. Mutations might have occured, however. Author Kyle Wagner

      • crossover

        public I_DnaThing crossover​(I_DnaThing parent2)
        Description copied from interface: I_DnaThing
        Takes this Genetic object and mixes it up with another genetic object, producing a third Genetic object. The usual case is to take 2 haploid genomes and create a third haploid consisting of various genes taken from each of the parents. Neither parent is modified in the process.
        Specified by:
        crossover in interface I_DnaThing
        Parameters:
        parent2 - Another Genetic object with which to mix components (genes or other parts).
